ratings.comment: Prof. co-teaches with a colleague, both very kind. Content is interesting & interspersed with jokes/videos, though lectures drain on. They legit highlight the most important stuff in the slides--this is what they test you on. Exams are straightforward if you go to lectures & pay attention. 3 exams, 3 EASY discussion posts, 1 cum. final, attendance.

You are only graded on discussion posts and exams, plus attendance at the END of class. There is zero outline for any of the exams despite him giving 60+ slide decks every lecture, which he just reads off of in the most painfully boring voice. I emailed him and the TA replied saying I shouldn't be burdening him with an email ? I hated this class.

Michael's lectures were always entertaining and interesting! Even though it was a late class, I was still motivated to go to listen to him lecture. His and the other lecturer's experience shines through during their lectures. I love to hear the stories and background of their careers. They both were very knowledgeable and experienced!

Super funny, he also taught with another professor. Lectures were super engaging and the topic was really interesting too. There were two books they say you need for class, but you don't really need to read anything. You're graded by 3 quizzes, 3 discussion posts (super easy), and 1 final cumulative exam. Definitely take the class.
Dry lectures but quizzes are easy enough

Tests are ridiculously hard. they expect you to remember random numbers from lectures. tests cover about 15 lectures worth of material and readings. Readings are also dense and usually 20 pages per class. Tests expect you to pull certain things from readings based on the author, super hard. Tests are monitored by honorlock.

Took the class in Fall. Co-teaches the class with another guy, both work as psychologists full-time. Exams are hard, but pay attention to the advice they give you about what to study because it's right on point with the exam materials. Overall, I really enjoyed this class! Almost every class broke up the long lecture with interesting/funny videos.

Caldwell was amazing. He is a practicing psychologist full time, so he has amazing stories to share. As long as you do the readings, show up to class, and study, you should have no issues getting an A. He claims that there are pop quizzes, but he tells you when they are, so do not fret! Amazing class that makes you think.

The class itself was easy, the quizzes especially. At first, he said they were "pop quizzes" but he actually tells you ahead of time when they will be. Three quizzes, paper, and debate project, all decently easy. HOWEVER, the curve is BRUTAL. Anything less than a 97 was a B! The only negative of this class.

Subject material is interesting, quizzes are straightforward, research paper & presentation are expected from an upper level psych course. Academically, not a bad class. Caldwell is a sweet guy, but it's very easy to lose interest/focus in class. He isn't the most engaging professor, but means well. Overall, a good 411 to take

Caldwell is super funny in a cheesy way. He makes lecture interesting by telling anecdotes from his life. He does not give exams, rather 4 short quizzes throughout the semester. BUT, don't be fooled! The questions are pretty tricky and these quizzes count for a big portion of your grade. Overall, Juvenile Delinquency is an interesting class

Caldwell knows this stuff like the back of his hand. Class is interesting and fair. He relates theories in criminology and new research to his clinical experience working with juvenile delinquents. This class is tight, Take it.

Great professor.  His lectures are always interesting and funny, and he makes things very clear.  It's a difficult class but if you attend lecture you'll be fine.  I definitely recommend taking a class with him if you're interested in the topic

Professor Caldwell is amazing! he is very smart and really knows what he is talking about. There are 4 pop quizzes, a research paper, and a presentation. No final which is a huge plus. I would definitely recommend the class
